title: "MasterLab"
author: "Group 2"
date: "01-03-2022"
output: html_document
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
install.packages("slider")
```

First of all we pre-load every need package in order to use them later for our analysis.
```{r Environment Creating}
library(quantmod)
library(tidyverse)
library(tidyquant)
library(timetk)
library(readxl)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(slider)
library(readr)
library(tibbletime)
library(zoo)
library(lmtest)
library(sandwich)
library(RcppEigen)
library(sandwich)
```

First of all we import our data sets, which contains the stock data that we received from Refinitiv. Furthermore, regarding the later analysis we also import the three Fama and French Factors in order to test later on our model.

```{r Data Import}
FF3 <- read_excel("Fama_Factor_Europe.xlsx", 
    col_types = c("date", "numeric", "numeric", 
        "numeric", "numeric"))

FF3_clean <- FF3 %>%
  filter(., Date > "1999-12-01",
         Date <= "2022-02-01") #Factor importing, which are later used for investigating alphas in the market

names(FF3_clean)[2] <- 'Mkt.RF'

rm(FF3)

raw_stock <- read_excel("Master_Lab.xlsx", 
    sheet = "R_Export", col_types = c("date", 
        "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", 
        "numeric", "numeric", "numeric",

raw_data <- raw_stock %>%
  filter(., Date < "2022-04-01")
ncol(raw_data)
print("number of stocks before filtering")
raw_data[raw_data == -5] <- NA #in order to remove the stocks, which do not contain any values at all
raw_data <- raw_data[ , colSums(is.na(raw_data)) == 0] 
raw_data[raw_data == -2] <- NA #If and Only if we want to only us full observation data otherwise choose e.g. 0
raw_data <- raw_data[ , colSums(is.na(raw_data)) == 0] #removes all the colums that do contain missing values
ncol(raw_data)
print("number of securities within the database after filtering")
security_id <- colnames(raw_data)
date <- raw_data[,1]
date_id <- ncol(raw_data)-1
security_id_02 <- raw_data[,2:date_id]
comp <- ncol(security_id_02)-1
security_id_02 <- security_id_02[ , apply(security_id_02, 2, function(x) !any(is.na(x)))]
comp_02 <- ncol(security_id_02)-1
try <- t(security_id_02)
sec_num <- rownames(try)
raw_data_02 <- merge(date, sec_num)
zwischen <- gather(security_id_02, "Stock_ID", "Returns")
zwischen_new <- zwischen[,2]
raw_stock_data <- cbind(raw_data_02, zwischen_new)
raw_stock_data <- raw_stock_data %>%
  dplyr::filter(Date >= "2000-01-01",
                Date <= "2022-02-01") %>%
  arrange(Date)

Inflation_monthly <- read_excel("Inflation_Data_Europe.xls", sheet = "R_Export_monthly", col_types = c("date","numeric", "numeric", "numeric","numeric", "numeric", "numeric","numeric", "numeric", "numeric","numeric", "numeric", "numeric","numeric", "numeric", "numeric","numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric"))

Inflation <- Inflation_monthly %>%
  dplyr::filter(Date >= "2000-01-01",
          Date <= "2022-02-01") %>%
          arrange(Date)

euro_inf <- Inflation %>% #change what kind of inflation should be observed
  select(Date, Euro_area) %>%
  mutate(Euro_area = Euro_area/100)

cl_stock <- right_join(x = euro_inf, y = raw_stock_data, by = "Date")
colnames(cl_stock) <- c("Date", "Inflation", "Stock_id", "Returns")
cl_stock <- right_join(x = cl_stock, y = FF3_clean, by = "Date")
data <- cl_stock %>%
  mutate(ret_exc = Returns - RF) %>%
  mutate(ret_exc_Inf_adj = ret_exc - Inflation) %>%
  mutate(ret_Inf_adj = Returns - Inflation)

rm(date, raw_data, raw_data_02, raw_stock, security_id_02, try, zwischen,zwischen_new, comp, comp_02, date_id, sec_num, security_id, Inflation_monthly, cl_stock, euro_inf, FF3_clean, Inflation, newdata, raw_stock_data)
gc()
data
summary(data$Returns)
nport <- 10 #determines the number of portfolios
```

After, the data cleaning we now continue with the beta calculations

```{r Defining the regression}
lmUNC <- function(data){ #In order to obtain the uncertainty betas
  if (mean(abs(data$Returns))<=-1 | mean(abs(data$Returns))>=100) {unc <- NA #in the case of extrem outlieres if a stock would have performed more than 100000% within a month
  } else if (sum(is.na(data$ret_exc))>24) {unc<-NA
  } else {
    unc <- fastLmPure(cbind(1,data$Inflation,data$Mkt.RF,data$SMB,data$HML),data$ret_exc)$coefficients[2]
  }
  return(unc)
}
```

Within the next section we perform a rolling regression, which uses the first 60 observation for each stock in order to estimate the uncertainty betas. We also rearrange the data set in _data_clean_beta_.

```{r Rolling regression and beta calculations}
lmUNC(data) #sampling the in order to see how it works before attack
lm(Returns ~ Inflation + Mkt.RF + SMB + HML, data = data) #performing the rolling regression in order to evaluate the stock exposure to inflation

data %>%
  mutate(Infl_beta = slide_dbl(.x = cur_data(), .f = ~lmUNC(data=.x), .before = 242, .after = 0, .complete = TRUE))

#Performing a rolling regression approach of X year training period
data_clean_beta <- data %>%
  group_by(Stock_id) %>%
  mutate(Infl_beta = slide_dbl(.x = cur_data(), .f = ~lmUNC(.), .before = 242, .after = 0, .complete = TRUE))
```
Below we split the betas into deciles in order to form _nport portfolios_. These portfolios are formed by sorting the stock according to their uncertainty betas. Therefore, we obtain ten different portfolios. Furthermore we calculate the Equal-weighted.

```{r Uncertainty Beta and Portfolio Construction}
#Data set which includes the beta portfolios and individual betas
data.pf <- data_clean_beta %>%
  filter(!is.na(Infl_beta), !is.na(Returns)) %>% #it excludes the training period because there are NA within it
  group_by(Date) %>%
  mutate(Infl_beta_port = ntile(Infl_beta, nport)) %>% #creates n-tile portfolios based on the whole basis
  ungroup()

#Provides an overview of the certain Infl_betas within the dataset
data.pf %>% 
  group_by(Infl_beta_port) %>%
  summarise(Infl_beta)

#Overview of Beta-Portfolios with their returns
pf <- data.pf %>%
  group_by(Date, Infl_beta_port) %>%
  summarise(ret_ew = mean(ret_exc)) #calculating the equally-weighted return of those portfolios

#Overview of the Portfolios and their equally-weighted return
ts_pf <- pf %>%
  group_by(Infl_beta_port) %>%
  summarise(across(contains("ret"),~mean(.)*100)) #average returns of the equally-weighted approach

#Overview of the individual portfolio according to their inflation betas
Inflation_betas <- data.pf %>%
  group_by(Infl_beta_port) %>%
  summarise(across(contains("Infl_beta"),~mean(.))) #Inflation Portfolios
```
The next chunk showcase the data preparation for the later followed alpha calculations. Therefore we filter the data set according to their factors.

```{r Portfolio Construction}
data_final_beta <- inner_join(data_clean_beta, data.pf, by=c("Date", "Stock_id")) %>%
  drop_na() %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  group_by(Date) %>%
  arrange(Date, Stock_id) %>%
  mutate(Infl_beta_port = ntile(Infl_beta.y, nport)) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  group_by(Date, Infl_beta_port) %>%
  arrange(Date, Infl_beta_port, Stock_id) %>%
  mutate(EW=1/n()) %>% 
  mutate(EW_EXRET = EW*ret_exc.x) #Weights multiplied by its excess rate


portfolios <- data_final_beta %>%
  mutate(EW_PORT_EXRET = sum(EW_EXRET)) %>%
  ungroup() %>% 
  group_by(Infl_beta_port, Date) %>%
  mutate(Infl_beta_average = mean(EW_PORT_EXRET))
```

The next step is to compute the different alphas for the _equally weighted_ portfolios. Furthermore, we also examined t-tests in order to test for the significance niveau.
In the following sections we calculate the alphas for the equally-weighted portfolios.

```{r Equally-Weighted Alpha Computations}
alpha_5_1_EW <- vector()
t_value_5_1_EW <- vector()
for (i in 1:nport){
  regression <- lm(EW_EXRET ~ Mkt.RF.x + SMB.x + HML.x, #computing the alphas by using the above imported Factors
                   data = portfolios %>%
                     distinct(Date, .keep_all = T) %>%
                     filter(Infl_beta_port == i))
  t_statistic <- coeftest(regression, vcov= NeweyWest(regression, verbose = T))
  alpha_5_1_EW[i] <- regression$coefficients[1]
  t_value_5_1_EW[i] <- t_statistic[1,3]
}
```

Final steps in order to bring everything together in order to present our finiding in the _Final_Table_.

```{r}
ew_overview <- cbind(alpha_5_1_EW,t_value_5_1_EW)
final_table <- cbind(ts_pf$Infl_beta_port, Inflation_betas$Infl_beta, ts_pf$ret_ew, ew_overview)
final_table <- as.data.frame(final_table)
hl_low_EW_alpha <- t(as.data.frame(ew_overview[1,]-ew_overview[nport,])) #needs to be adapt according to the portfolio number
hl_lo_EW_RET <- as.data.frame(ts_pf[nport,2]-ts_pf[1,2])
text <- t(c("High-","Low"))
last_row <- cbind(text,hl_lo_EW_RET,hl_low_EW_alpha)

final_table <- final_table %>%
  rename(nPort = V1) %>%
  rename("RET-RF_EW" = V3) %>%
  rename("Infl_Beta"= V2)

last_row <- last_row %>%
  rename(nPort = 1) %>%
  rename("RET-RF_EW" = ret_ew) %>%
  rename("Infl_Beta"= 2)

final_table <- rbind(final_table, last_row)
final_table
```

The last step is to export our findings in order to put them into the right fashion regarding the final presentation.


_Equally Market Portfolio_

```{r, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
sep_oos <- as.Date("2010-01-01")                            # Starting point for backtest
ticks <- data.pf$Stock_id %>%                               # List of all asset ids
    as.factor() %>%
    levels()
features <- colnames(data.pf[2:13])
features_short <- features
N <- length(ticks)                                          # Max number of assets
returns <- data.pf %>%
  select(Stock_id,Date,Returns) #the returns are calculated

t_oos <- returns$Date[returns$Date > sep_oos] %>%           # Out-of-sample dates 
    unique() %>%                                            # Remove duplicates
    as.Date(origin = "1970-01-01")                          # Transform in date format
Tt <- length(t_oos)                                         # Nb of dates, avoid T = TRUE
nb_port <- 1                                                # Nb of portfolios/strategies
portf_weights <- array(0, dim = c(Tt, nb_port, N))          # Initialize portfolio weights, three dimensional object
portf_returns <- matrix(0, nrow = Tt, ncol = nb_port)       # Initialize portfolio returns 

portf_compo <- function(train_data, test_data, features, j){ 
    if(j == 1){                                 # This is the benchmark
        N <- test_data$Stock_id %>%             # Test data dictates allocation
            factor() %>%
          nlevels()
        w <- 1/N                                # EW portfolio
        w$weights <- rep(w,N)
        w$names <- unique(test_data$Stock_id)   # Asset names
        return(w)
    }
}

m_offset <- 0                                          # Offset in months for buffer period
train_size <- 5                                         # Size of training set in years
for(t in 1:(length(t_oos)-1)){                          # Stop before last date: no fwd ret.!
    if(t%%12==0){print(t_oos[t])}                       # Just checking the date status
    train_data <- data.pf %>% filter(Date < t_oos[t] - m_offset * 30,   # Roll window w. buffer
                                    Date > t_oos[t] - m_offset * 30 - 365 * train_size)    
    test_data <- data.pf %>% filter(Date == t_oos[t])   # Test sample  
    realized_returns <- test_data %>%                   # Computing returns via:
        dplyr::select(Returns)                          # 1M holding period!
    for(j in 1:nb_port){    
        temp_weights <- portf_compo(train_data, test_data, features_short, j) # Weights
        ind <- match(temp_weights$names, ticks) %>%
          na.omit()           # Index: test vs all
        portf_weights[t,j,ind] <- temp_weights$weights                  # Allocate weights 
        portf_returns[t,j] <- sum(temp_weights$weights * realized_returns) # Compute returns
    }
}

turnover <- function(weights, asset_returns, t_oos){ 
    turn <- 0
    for(t in 2:length(t_oos)){
        realised_returns <- returns %>% filter(Date == t_oos[t]) %>% dplyr::select(-Date)
        prior_weights <- weights[t-1,] * (1 + realised_returns) # Before rebalancing
        turn <- turn + apply(abs(weights[t,] - prior_weights/sum(prior_weights)),1,sum)
    }
    return(turn/(length(t_oos)-1))
}

perf_met <- function(portf_returns, weights, asset_returns, t_oos){ 
    avg_ret <- mean(portf_returns, na.rm = T)                     # Arithmetic mean 
    vol <- sd(portf_returns, na.rm = T)                           # Volatility
    Sharpe_ratio <- avg_ret / vol                                 # Sharpe ratio
    VaR_5 <- quantile(portf_returns, 0.05)                        # Value-at-risk
    turn <- 0                                                     # Initialisation of turnover
    for(t in 2:dim(weights)[1]){
        realized_returns <- asset_returns %>% filter(Date == t_oos[t]) %>% dplyr::select(-Date)
        prior_weights <- weights[t-1,] * (1 + realized_returns)
        turn <- turn + apply(abs(weights[t,] - prior_weights/sum(prior_weights)),1,sum)
    }
    turn <- turn/(length(t_oos)-1)                                # Average over time
    met <- data.frame(avg_ret, vol, Sharpe_ratio, VaR_5, turn)    # Aggregation of all of this
    rownames(met) <- "metrics"
    return(met)
}

perf_met_multi <- function(portf_returns, weights, asset_returns, t_oos, strat_name){
    J <- dim(weights)[2]              # Number of strategies 
    met <- c()                        # Initialization of metrics
    for(j in 1:J){                    # One very ugly loop
        temp_met <- perf_met(portf_returns[, j], weights[, j, ], asset_returns, t_oos)
        met <- rbind(met, temp_met)
    }
    row.names(met) <- strat_name      # Stores the name of the strat
    return(met)
}

asset_returns <- data.pf %>%                          # Compute return matrix: start from data
    dplyr::select(Date, Stock_id, Returns) %>%        # Keep 3 attributes 
    pivot_wider(names_from = Stock_id, values_from = Returns)           # Shape in matrix format
asset_returns[is.na(asset_returns)] <- 0              # Zero returns for missing points

met <- perf_met_multi(portf_returns = portf_returns,  # Computes performance metrics
                      weights = portf_weights, 
                      asset_returns = asset_returns,
                      t_oos = t_oos,
                      strat_name = c("EW"))
met 
```
